summary: This is an email from Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers to defense attorneys Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Mennin regarding the upcoming jury selection in the case United States v. Maxwell. It attaches a list of prospective jurors who will return for peremptory strikes on November 29, 2021, and notes that jurors will not be excused until the jury is sworn in.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the case in which Pagliuca is defense counsel; her chambers communicates procedural information to him.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the case in which Mennin is defense counsel; her chambers communicates procedural information to her.
Both are listed as recipients of the email from the court, indicating they are part of the defense counsel team for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Peremptory Strikes in Jury Selection
events.description: Prospective jurors will return for the exercise of peremptory strikes in the US v. Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The document is an email from Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers to defense attorneys Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Mennin regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial (case 20cr330).
It provides a list of prospective jurors who will return for peremptory strikes on November 29, 2021.
The court's jury department will not excuse remaining jurors from service until the jury is sworn in, indicating a cautious procedural approach.
The document confirms ongoing jury selection proceedings in the high-profile US v. Maxwell case in late 2021.
